page.title: 08LANDSCAPE OF HEADLEY PARK
page.content: {LANDSCAPE} Headley Park is built on top of a hill. That is where it got its name from. Head because it was high up and ley because it had lots of grasslands. There is a big stream in{Headley Park called the Malago which has uncultivated grassland on both sides. In the Malago or Manor Woods there are very steep slopes (we call them donkey slides). There is a big grassland called Highridge Common. In Headley Park and Bedminster Down there are allotments _ one in Headley Lane and another in Bishopsworth Road. There are lots of playing fields in the area. There is a church called St. Peter's Church. It was built in 1842 and all of the stone was imported from Caen in France. There are some industrial buildings mainly warehouses for a supermarket chain. A.MOORE.
